issues.description: The problem statement specifies a class named 'Stock' for managing the saloon's inventory, but both the template and solution use a class named 'Inventory' instead. This mismatch in class naming and type will confuse students who expect a Stock.java to exist and need to use a Stock type.
issues.suggested_fix: Unify the naming: either rename the 'Inventory' class (and file) to 'Stock' and update all references in code, or adjust the problem statement and UML to refer to 'Inventory' instead of 'Stock' so that the class names align across all artifacts.

issues.description: The problem statement specifies a class named `Stock`, but both the template and solution repositories provide and use a class named `Inventory` for the same functionality. Students may search for `Stock.java` and be confused when only `Inventory.java` exists.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the `Inventory` class in both template and solution code to `Stock` (and adjust references accordingly), or update the problem statement to refer consistently to `Inventory` instead of `Stock`.
